content.text: Dictionaries store key-value pairs. Keys must be hashable and unique, while values can be any Python object.

items: Use descriptive keys that reflect the stored data.
Access values with square brackets when you expect the key to exist.
Use `.get()` to provide a default when the key might be missing.

content.text: Dictionaries are mutable. You can add, update, or remove key-value pairs using familiar syntax.

items: Assign with `my_dict[key] = value` to insert or update.
Call `del my_dict[key]` to remove a key.
Iterate with `.items()`, `.keys()`, or `.values()` depending on what you need.
